This is not at all a heritrix answer but some tricks to do what you want (I=
 think)

In Denmark we use a couple of very simple bash-scripts based on ns=
lookup and wget to deal with this (you need the IDN-library to deal with ID=
N-encoded domain names)

check_frontpages.sh:
#!/bin/bash
while read I; do =
IDN=3D$(idn --quiet $I); IP=3D$(nslookup www.$IDN | tail -2 | grep Address =
| cut -d' ' -f2); if [ ! -z $IP ]; then MD=3D$(wget --timeout=3D10 --tries=
=3D1 --quiet www.$IDN -O /dev/stdout | md5sum); CODE=3D$(wget -S --timeout=
=3D10 --tries=3D1 www.$IDN -O /dev/null -o /dev/stdout  | egrep 'HTTP\/'); =
echo $I $IP $MD $CODE; else echo $I not found; fi; done 

check_redirects.s=
h
#!/bin/bash
while read I; do IDN=3D$(idn --quiet $I); wget -S --timeout=
=3D10 --tries=3D1 www.$IDN -O /dev/null 2>/dev/stdout | grep -i 'location.*=
http'; done 

usage examples:
echo netarkivet.dk | ./check_frontpages.sh gi=
ves
netarkivet.dk 130.225.27.144 757cebab4dcc1dec91905dc17d2adeaf - HTTP/1.=
1 302 Found HTTP/1.1 302 Found HTTP/1.1 200 OK

echo doesnotexist.dk | ./ch=
eck_frontpages.sh gives
doesnotexist.dk not found

echo lego.dk | ./check_r=
edirects.sh gives
  Location: http://www.lego.com/en-us/ms/default.aspx?lci=
d=3D1030&redir=3Dhttp://www.lego.com/da-dk/default.aspx&domainredir=3Dwww.l=
ego.dk
Location: http://www.lego.com/en-us/ms/default.aspx?lcid=3D1030&redi=
r=3Dhttp://www.lego.com/da-dk/default.aspx&domainredir=3Dwww.lego.dk [follo=
wing]
  Location: http://www.lego.com/da-dk/default.aspx
Location: http://w=
ww.lego.com/da-dk/default.aspx [following]

We use check_redirects.sh for c=
hecking redicts to NON-.dk-domains from frontpages of .dk-domains to discov=
er NON .dk-domains to include in our national domain crawls.

best
Bjarne

Hi,

For constituing our new broad crawl at BnF, I have to a=
nalyze our list of domains to first:

- mark domains that have no DNS entry=

- detect redirections from seed URLS

I have a couple of alternatives to s=
tudy, but having a bit of experience with Heritrix, I'd rather go with it. =
I knpow where to find the information I need in the crawl reports and logs,=
 however I am quite unsure at how to configure the crawl order to limit the=
 crawl to just get a DNS answer.

Any help would be greatly appreciated,

B=
est regards,

--
Nicolas Giraud
